file_content.text: The Force is with us, Commander. We must not fail.
The attack is underway. Our allies have engaged the enemy. The rest is up to us.
I will maneuver our allies into position and meet you inside the shield generator's bunker.
We are finally ready, Commander. I have signaled our allies we have the supplies they need to bolster our assault.
Our allies will be ready to fight once we can supply them. I've found a few caches. How goes your search, Commander?
Good news, Commander. I have successfully negotiated an alliance of minor noble houses to help us assault the shield generator.
Seek out the enemy's fortified shield generator. If you discover external defenses, destroy them.
You are the Commander I've heard so much about. Welcome. I am Choza Raabat of the Jedi Order. I serve your Alliance.
Safe journeys on Alderaan. May the Force be with you.
It is finally done, Commander. The sky over Alderaan is free of the Star Fortress's shadow.
I see my decision to join your Alliance was the correct one. I am only one Jedi, but I will serve you with the same loyalty I gave the Order.
Whenever you need me, I stand ready to fight by your side. May the Force be with you.
The enemy station over Alderaan is vulnerable, but it will take great effort to destroy the Star Fortress from within.
I'm coordinating strikes by our warships to keep the enemy off-balance. They're buying you time to enter the Star Fortress and bring it crashing down.
When the enemy stronghold falls, I'll be free to join you on other missions. Hurry, Commander. Alderaan needs your help.
The Star Fortress has lost its defensive shield. Now, the final assault can begin.
I made a disturbing discovery about the motive behind Zakuul's actions on Alderaan. The enemy is more depraved than I thought possible.
Zakuul has orchestrated chaos here to record the resulting violence and broadcast it as entertainment for its people.
They're doing all this to entertain Zakuul's people? That's horrible!
Do the people of Zakuul actually enjoy seeing this?
I don't know how many partake of the holofeeds, or why. Perhaps Zakuul's people don't realize what they're seeing is actually happening.
If they want a show, I'll give it to them.
We must not stoop to the enemy's level. The Alliance must be better, or all of this is for nothing.
We've done all we can to help Alderaan from here. We must now go to Odessen and plan the assault on the Star Fortress.
I will meet you there, Commander. And when we've achieved total victory, I look forward to serving at your side.
I have identified a perfect location to set the detonation charges. We'll go together, Commander.
Go to the shield generator and breach its outer walls. I will find you inside, and together we will destroy the facility.
[Turn in supply crates.]
Excellent. This will help our cause.
[Report the Alderaan Resistance Campaign is complete to receive a massive Influence gain.]
You have undermined Zakuul's efforts to destabilize Alderaan--and saved countless lives. Well done.
But our work is not yet finished. The supplies we have are still not enough to destroy that shield generator.
I'll find more supplies.
May the Force be with us.
[Start the Alderaan Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
Zakuul's schemes to pit the noble houses against each other must be ended. Seek those in a position to settle these pointless conflicts and help them achieve victory.
[Start a Heroic Mission to secure supply crates.]
There are many in need of our help. Anything we do to aid them will be rewarded with the supplies we need.
[Start an Eternal Empire Champion Duel.]
Zakuul has dispatched agents to Alderaan. They may be hunting us. Our best hope of remaining undetected is to eliminate these threats.
When you have more supplies, meet me back here. Until then, Commander.
They were deeply impressed by your victory over the shield bunker's guardian. You proved Zakuul is not invulnerable.
Time to finish the job and destroy that shield generator.
Which noble houses have offered to join us?
None you would recognize. They are houses that have lost everything to this war except the will to free their home world.
Destroying the enemy would've been easier with you helping me.
We do not walk an easy path, unfortunately.
It will take a strong coordinated effort to bring down the shield generator. People, weapons, supplies.
Our allies have been beaten down by years of war. They can commit forces to the cause, but they lack adequate materiel.
The larger noble houses--and our enemy--have the supplies we need. We should split up and do what we must to secure them.
The more conflicts orchestrated by Zakuul that we can end now, the better-off Alderaan will be when the Star Fortress falls.
Seek those in need of help, gather what supplies you can, and meet me here. Be safe, Commander.
I'm relieved to meet a fellow Jedi. It seems like there aren't many of us left.
There are not. Those who didn't fall to the Eternal Empire have scattered to the fringes. I've tried contacting them, without success.
That failure extends to reuniting your former crew. Kira Carsen has proved especially difficult to locate.
Kira and I were close, but I haven't felt her presence, either. I don't know what that means.
As Jedi, we must remain above such worries. If you and Kira are meant to be reunited, it will happen.
I'm more concerned about the Sith, Lord Scourge. If he isn't dead, then his silence after my return is troubling.
I admit, the records of your connection to the Emperor's Wrath surprised me. Such ties rarely last long.
Have you found anything about "Doc?" He isn't a Jedi.
A man matching his description is rumored to be wandering the Outer Rim, but I can't say if that information is true or not.
I had hoped to locate your old crew, Barsen'thor, but their whereabouts remain unknown. I offer myself in their place.
My padawan, Nadia Grell, was young and inexperienced. I worry what's become of her.
She's not the first padawan to lose her master. In the end, we can only hope she follows the path.
If anyone could cover his own tracks so well even a Jedi couldn't follow them, it's Tharan Cedrax.
The datafiles describing him and "Holiday" were... colorful, to say the least.
Lieutenant Iresso is Republic military. He shouldn't be that hard to locate.
He is officially listed as MIA. My access to unofficial records is limited, unfortunately.
I thank you for trying to find them.
I know how it feels to lose allies without warning.
Attachments are not the Jedi way. The past is behind us, and the future is uncertain. We must focus on the present.
I, too, was once forced by fate to release my old attachments.
I've worked with Jedi before, but I'm not used to ordering them around. How do you feel about this arrangement?
I'll do whatever you require of me. I volunteered for this assignment.
You serve a Sith. That must be difficult for you.
It's not difficult at all, because I don't serve you. I follow a path laid before me by Grand Master Satele Shan.
I received a message from her, telling me you would come here. She wants your Alliance to succeed.
It's my job to ensure your victory over the Eternal Empire. No more, and no less.
I wish to speak with Satele Shan. Make it happen.
I would do so if it were within my power. Our communications are controlled by her. If that changes, I'll inform you.
Obey my commands and spare me your simpleminded Jedi rhetoric.
Of course. One cannot fill a closed vessel.
I will not pretend we're anything alike, but I can sympathize with your situation.
We might become friends. Give it a chance.
Jedi are taught to welcome new possibilities. I will try.
I've never had a Jedi under my command. Are you prepared to accept orders from someone like me?
I wouldn't be here if I weren't ready to serve.
No, you serve me. I command the Alliance, and everyone in it.
If my loyalties concern you, understand I have no attachments to anything or anyone.
Does the Jedi Order serve the Alliance, or just you?
I don't presume to speak for the entire Order. My path to this moment was long and difficult.
You and I have something unique in common. We both became exiles against our wills, and returned to a galaxy that had changed in our absence.
Twelve years ago, I was on a scouting mission in Wild Space. My ship crashed on a barren world. I had no way to summon rescue.
I was alone for ten years, until a survey vessel from Zakuul set down on my planet. First contact with its crew went... poorly.
I assumed command of their vessel and discovered everything had changed while I was stranded. War had resumed, but the only victor was Zakuul.
Twelve years... you missed a lot more than I did.
The galaxy was at peace when I left it. I knew it couldn't last, but I never imagined all this.
What happened to the crew from Zakuul? Did you kill them all?
I harmed no one. I subdued them, questioned them, and released them to safety.
It was kind of you to let them go free.
There was no kindness to what I did. It was simply the Jedi way.
Did you learn anything useful?
I learned that I needed to redefine my place in the galaxy. I believe you understand what that is like.
You're a fool. Zakuul's people don't deserve mercy. If they could've killed you, they would have.
I'm not defined by my enemy's actions--only my own.
How did you wind up with the Alliance?
I visited Asylum on my way back to Republic space. I saw the suffering there, even before Emperor Arcann's attack.
When I heard what happened to Asylum--and the rise of your Alliance in response--I knew I would join.
But I have strayed far from our present concerns. The mission here is vital.
Alderaan has suffered greater than any of the Core Worlds. Matters have only worsened since Zakuul placed its Star Fortress in orbit.
I have tracked the enemy's activities, and one thing is clear: Zakuul is actively encouraging Alderaan's civil war. The noble houses are more hostile than ever.
Alderaan's leaders are responsible for this conflict--not Zakuul. The civil war existed years before the Eternal Empire got here.
While you were away, the houses made a concerted effort to settle things peacefully. Zakuul has undermined that process at every turn.
How is Zakuul turning the noble houses against each other?
The enemy has carried out a series of assassinations and sabotage operations. Each time, they've misdirected blame to an innocent noble house.
Maybe all these worthless nobles will finally kill each other. Problem solved.
It's not the nobles who bear the brunt of this violence. It's their subjects. The poor and innocent die by the thousands.
The Star Fortress is the heart of Zakuul's treachery on Alderaan. With it removed, this world might have a chance to rebuild.
But the battle station is protected by a powerful shield generator here on the surface. We must eliminate it, first.
I have an important meeting with potential allies. Your best course of action is to scout the shield generator's location and test its vulnerabilities.
May the Force be with you, Commander.
Zakuul's schemes to pit the noble houses against each other must be ended. Seek those in a position to settle these pointless conflicts and help them achieve victory.
[Turn in Alien Research crate.]
[Turn in Military Equipment crate.]
[Turn in Ancient Artifact crate.]
[Turn in Smuggled Goods crate.]
[Go Back.]
[Do Nothing.]
The lone Bafforr tree is silent and unfulfilled, but the forest is all-wise and capable. Sow our seeds, Commander.
I have been away from the galaxy for some time. Much has changed--especially the company.
The Force will see us to victory.
We remain vigilant, Commander.
Find peace among your allies. Together, we preserve.
I'm happy to share stories with you, Commander. My wisdom is yours.
The path to the future requires that we trim away the thorns of the past. Let the Force be your guide.
This Alliance will see harmony and balance returned to the galaxy.
